page.title: 14The Media
page.content: In Kent there are two main local newspapers and one BBC local radio station.The two papers are called The Kent Courier and The Kent Messenger. Each covers a great deal of local news.At the time of this project there is a strike and we have no information on the Courier.According to our survey the Messenger was the most popular paper.It is over 125 years old and has always been owned by the Boorway family.45,000 coppies of the paper in 4 editions are sold every week.It is politically independent ,informative,entertaining and encourages reader involvment (competitions,letters).The radio station is"surprisingly"called Radio Kent but when it began in December 1970 it broadcasted under the name of Radio Medway.On the 2nd July 1983 the name was changed.40 people are employed
